text: Cédric Marie Carlos Thérèse Van Branteghem (born 13 March 1979 in Ghent) is a Belgian sprinter, who specializes in the 400 metres. ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |2001 |European U23 Championships |Amsterdam, Netherlands |17th (h) |400m |47.65 |- |2002 |European Championships |Munich, Germany |align="center" | 6th |400 m |45.95 |- |2003 |World Athletics Final |Monte Carlo, Monaco |align="center" | 6th |400 m | 46.02 |- |2005 |Universiade |İzmir, Turkey |align="center" | 4th |400 m |46.17 |- |2010 |European Championships |Barcelona, Spain |align="center" width=40 bgcolor=cc9966| 3rd |4 × 400 m |3:02.60 s |} ===Personal bests=== *100 metres - 10.54 s (2003) *200 metres - 20.60 s (2003) *400 metres - 45.02 s (2003) ==References== ==External links== * * * * Category:1979 births Category:Living people Category:Belgian male sprinters Category:Olympic athletes of Belgium Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2004 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2008 Summer Olympics Category:Sportspeople from Ghent Category:European Athletics Championships medalists Category:World Athletics Indoor Championships medalists
title: Cédric Van Branteghem
